Creating a Secure, Interoperable Payments Gateway with Blockchain

To build a payments gateway that connects banks, cards, mobile money, and blockchain with LevelOne Project principles, here's a comprehensive framework:

Core Architecture Components

1. Foundation Layer (Based on LevelOne Principles)

  • Interoperability Framework: Adopt LevelOne's principles of inclusive design, shared infrastructure, and collaborative governance

  • Open Standards: Use ISO 20022, Open Banking APIs, and blockchain interoperability protocols

  • Decentralized Identity: Implement DID (Decentralized Identifiers) for participants

2. Security Core

  • Hybrid Blockchain Architecture:

    • Private/permissioned blockchain for sensitive transaction data

    • Public blockchain anchors for immutability

  • Zero-Knowledge Proofs: For privacy-preserving transaction validation

  • Multi-Party Computation: For secure key management

3. Connectivity Layer

  • Bank API Adapters: Built with PSD2/Open Banking standards

  • Card Network Connectors: Supporting Visa Direct, Mastercard Send

  • Mobile Money Gateways: Unified API for M-Pesa, MTN Mobile Money, etc.

  • Blockchain Bridges: Cross-chain interoperability (e.g., Polkadot, Cosmos)

Key Functional Components

1. Unified Payments API

  • RESTful/gRPC API with:

    • Payment initiation (PISP)

    • Account information (AISP)

    • Bulk payment processing

    • Wallet operations

  1. Certifications:

YetuPay: Building a Secure, Interoperable Payments Gateway

Vision

YetuPay will be a real-time, blockchain-secured, interoperable payments gateway that connects:
✅ Banks (via Open Banking APIs)
✅ Card Networks (Visa, Mastercard, etc.)
✅ Mobile Money (M-Pesa, Airtel Money, MTN, etc.)
✅ Blockchain Networks (Stablecoins, CBDCs, DeFi)
✅ Third-Party Payment Initiation (PISPs, AISPs)

Built on LevelOne Project principles (inclusive, interoperable, secure) with a hybrid blockchain core for settlement transparency.

// /src/routes/dfsps.ts
import express from 'express';
import { validateDIDAuth } from '../middleware/auth';
import { routePayment } from '../services/payment-router';

const router = express.Router();

// DFSPS register their capabilities
router.post('/register', validateDIDAuth, (req, res) => {
  // Store in Couchbase 'dfsps' bucket
});

// Payment routing endpoint
router.post('/route', validateDIDAuth, async (req, res) => {
  const { dfspsId, transaction } = req.body;
  
  // 1. Validate against smart contract
  // 2. Route to appropriate rail
  const result = await routePayment(dfspsId, transaction);
  
  // 3. Store in Couchbase with blockchain proof
  res.json({
    status: "completed",
    txHash: result.blockchainProof,
    couchbaseRef: result.cbDocId
  });
});

export default router;

// Couchbase Eventing Function: onTransactionUpdate
function OnUpdate(doc, meta) {
  if (doc.type === 'transaction' && doc.status === 'pending') {
    // Send to blockchain
    const txHash = callBlockchainService(doc);
    
    // Update document with proof
    doc.blockchainProof = txHash;
    doc.anchoredAt = new Date();
    couchbase.upsert(meta.id, doc);
  }
}

3. Payment Routing Service

typescript
Copy
Download
// /src/services/payment-router.ts
import { couchbase } from '../db';
import { validateOnChain } from '../blockchain';

export async function routePayment(dfspsId: string, tx: PaymentTx) {
  // 1. Check DFSPS capabilities
  const dfsps = await couchbase.get(`dfsps::${dfspsId}`);
  
  // 2. Validate liquidity via smart contract
  const canSettle = await validateOnChain(tx);
  
  // 3. Route to appropriate rail
  let result;
  if (dfsps.supportsMobileMoney && tx.rail === 'mobile') {
    result = await mobileMoneyService.send(tx);
  } else if (dfsps.supportsBank && tx.rail === 'bank') {
    result = await bankService.send(tx);
  }
  
  // 4. Store with blockchain proof
  const doc = {
    ...tx,
    status: 'completed',
    blockchainProof: result.txHash,
    timestamp: new Date()
  };
  
  await couchbase.insert(`transactions::${tx.id}`, doc);
  
  return {
    cbDocId: tx.id,
    blockchainProof: result.txHash
  };
}

// /src/blockchain/index.ts
import { Contract } from 'ethers';
import settlementABI from './abis/SettlementValidator.json';

export async function validateOnChain(tx: PaymentTx): Promise<boolean> {
  const contract = new Contract(
    process.env.SETTLEMENT_CONTRACT_ADDRESS,
    settlementABI,
    provider
  );
  
  return await contract.verifyLiquidity(
    tx.dfspsId,
    tx.amount,
    tx.currency
  );
}

6. Daily Settlement Reconciliation

typescript
Copy
Download
// /src/jobs/dailySettlement.ts
import { couchbase } from '../db';
import { batchSettleOnChain } from '../blockchain';

export async function runDailySettlement() {
  // 1. Get all completed transactions
  const query = `
    SELECT META().id, * 
    FROM yetupay.transactions
    WHERE status = 'completed'
    AND DATE_DIFF_STR(NOW(), anchoredAt, 'day') = 0`;
  
  const transactions = await couchbase.query(query);
  
  // 2. Create settlement batch on-chain
  const batchId = await batchSettleOnChain(transactions);
  
  // 3. Move to settlements collection
  await couchbase.query(`
    UPDATE yetupay.transactions
    SET batchId = $1, status = 'settled'
    WHERE status = 'completed'
  `, [batchId]);
}

A. ISO 20022 Message Adapter (Express Middleware)

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/middleware/iso20022.ts
import { pacs008, pain001 } from 'iso20022-connector';

export const validateISO20022 = (messageType: 'pacs.008' | 'pain.001') => {
  return (req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => {
    try {
      const validated = messageType === 'pacs.008' 
        ? pacs008.validate(req.body)
        : pain001.validate(req.body);
      req.isoMessage = validated;
      next();
    } catch (error) {
      res.status(400).json({ error: 'Invalid ISO 20022 format' });
    }
  };
};

3. Account Validation Flow

Private Blockchain Lookup Service

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/services/account-validator.ts
import { couchbase } from '../db';
import { privateChain } from '../blockchain/private';

export async function validateAccounts(
  payer: { id: string, dfsp: string },
  payee: { id: string, dfsp: string }
) {
  // 1. Check Private Chain for cached validation
  const payerValid = await privateChain.query('Validations', {
    selector: { id: payer.id, dfsp: payer.dfsp }
  });
  
  const payeeValid = await privateChain.query('Validations', {
    selector: { id: payee.id, dfsp: payee.dfsp }
  });

  // 2. Fallback to DFSP API if not cached
  if (!payerValid || !payeeValid) {
    return await validateViaDFSPApi(payer, payee);
  }

  return { payerValid, payeeValid };
}

Consortium Chain Balance Check

solidity
Copy
Download
// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

contract BalanceVerifier {
    struct Account {
        address dfspNode;
        uint256 balance;
        uint256 lastUpdated;
    }
    
    mapping(string => Account) public accounts;

    function verifyBalance(
        string memory accountId,
        uint256 requiredAmount
    ) public view returns (bool) {
        Account memory acc = accounts[accountId];
        require(acc.lastUpdated > block.timestamp - 1 days, "Stale data");
        return acc.balance >= requiredAmount;
    }
}

4. Complete Transaction Flow with Intel Layer

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/routes/intel-router.ts
import express from 'express';
import {
  validateISO20022,
  fraudCheck,
  validateAccounts,
  verifyBalance,
  lockFunds
} from '../intel-layer';

const router = express.Router();

router.post('/process', validateISO20022('pacs.008'), async (req, res) => {
  const { payer, payee, amount } = req.isoMessage;
  
  // 1. Account Validation
  const { payerValid, payeeValid } = await validateAccounts(payer, payee);
  if (!payerValid || !payeeValid) {
    return res.status(400).json({ error: 'Invalid account details' });
  }

  // 2. Balance Check (Consortium Chain)
  const hasBalance = await verifyBalance(payer.id, amount);
  if (!hasBalance) {
    return res.status(403).json({ error: 'Insufficient funds' });
  }

  // 3. Fraud Check
  const isFraud = await fraudCheck(req.isoMessage);
  if (isFraud) {
    await couchbase.insert('flagged_transactions', req.body);
    return res.status(403).json({ error: 'Fraud detected' });
  }

  // 4. Fund Locking (Smart Contract)
  const lockTx = await lockFunds(payer.id, amount);
  
  // 5. Execute Settlement
  const settlementResult = await routePayment({
    ...req.isoMessage,
    blockchainProof: lockTx.hash
  });

  res.json({
    status: 'completed',
    settlementRef: settlementResult.settlementId,
    txHash: lockTx.hash
  });
});

Copy
Download
// src/intel-layer/fraud-check.ts
import { trainFraudModel } from './ml-models';

export async function fraudCheck(isoMessage: any) {
  // 1. Rule-Based Checks
  const highRiskCountries = ['XX', 'YY', 'ZZ'];
  if (highRiskCountries.includes(isoMessage.originCountry)) {
    return true;
  }

  // 2. ML Model Prediction
  const model = await trainFraudModel();
  const prediction = model.predict(isoMessage);
  
  return prediction.riskScore > 0.85;
}

Routing Cache Warmup (Cron Job)

typescript

// src/jobs/route-optimizer.ts
import { couchbase } from '../db';

export async function warmRoutingCache() {
  // Get frequently used routes
  const query = `
    SELECT dfspId, destinationType, COUNT(*) as usageCount
    FROM yetupay.routing_rules
    GROUP BY dfspId, destinationType
    ORDER BY usageCount DESC
    LIMIT 100`;
  
  const popularRoutes = await couchbase.query(query);
  
  // Pre-load into private chain
  await privateChain.invoke('RoutingCache', 'bulkLoad', popularRoutes);
}

Express Router for Dynamic KYC

// src/routes/kyc-onboarding.ts
import express from 'express';
import { getKycRequirements } from '../services/kyc-engine';

const router = express.Router();

// Get KYC requirements based on participant type
router.get('/requirements', (req, res) => {
  const { participantType, jurisdiction } = req.query;
  
  const requirements = getKycRequirements(
    participantType as string, 
    jurisdiction as string
  );
  
  res.json({ requirements });
});

// Submit KYC documents
router.post('/submit', async (req, res) => {
  const { participantDid, documents } = req.body;
  
  // 1. Store in Couchbase
  await couchbase.upsert(`kyc_submissions::${participantDid}`, {
    documents,
    status: "under_review"
  });
  
  // 2. Anchor hash to blockchain
  const docHash = hashDocuments(documents);
  await blockchain.anchorKyc(participantDid, docHash);
  
  res.json({ status: "received", docHash });
});

export default router;

KYC Rules Engine

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/services/kyc-engine.ts
interface KycRule {
  participantType: string;
  jurisdiction?: string;
  requiredDocs: string[];
}

const kycRules: KycRule[] = [
  // Consumers
  {
    participantType: "consumer",
    requiredDocs: ["id_card", "selfie_verification"]
  },
  
  // FinTech Startups
  {
    participantType: "fintech_company",
    requiredDocs: ["certificate_of_incorporation", "director_ids"]
  },
  
  // Banks
  {
    participantType: "financial_institution",
    jurisdiction: "KE",
    requiredDocs: ["banking_license", "cbk_approval_letter"]
  },
  
  // Regulators
  {
    participantType: "regulator",
    requiredDocs: ["government_credential"]
  }
];

export function getKycRequirements(
  participantType: string, 
  jurisdiction?: string
): string[] {
  return kycRules
    .filter(rule => {
      const typeMatch = rule.participantType === participantType;
      const jurisdictionMatch = !rule.jurisdiction || 
        rule.jurisdiction === jurisdiction;
      return typeMatch && jurisdictionMatch;
    })
    .flatMap(rule => rule.requiredDocs);
}

        await yetupay_chain.store_credential(did, credential_offer)

5. Participant Access Matrix

Role-Based Permission Smart Contract

solidity
Copy
Download
// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

contract ParticipantPermissions {
    struct Participant {
        uint tier;
        bytes32 participantType; // "consumer", "fintech", "bank", etc.
        string[] jurisdictions;
        bool kycVerified;
    }
    
    mapping(address => Participant) public participants;
    
    function checkAccess(
        address participant,
        string memory permission
    ) public view returns (bool) {
        Participant memory p = participants[participant];
        
        if (!p.kycVerified) return false;
        
        if (keccak256(bytes(p.participantType)) == keccak256(bytes("regulator"))) {
            return true; // Regulators have full access
        }
        
        if (keccak256(bytes(permission)) == keccak256(bytes("payment_initiation"))) {
            return p.tier >= 1; // FinTechs and above
        }
        
        if (keccak256(bytes(permission)) == keccak256(bytes("bulk_settlement"))) {
            return p.tier >= 2; // Banks and above
        }
    }
}

// Generate reports for different regulators
export async function generateRegulatoryReport(
  regulatorType: 'central_bank' | 'fatf' | 'data_protection'
) {
  const query = `
    SELECT participantType, COUNT(*) 
    FROM yetupay.kyc_profiles
    WHERE kycVerified = true
    GROUP BY participantType`;
  
  const results = await couchbase.query(query);
  
  switch (regulatorType) {
    case 'central_bank':
      return formatForCentralBank(results);
    case 'fatf':
      return addAMLData(results);
    case 'data_protection':
      return anonymize(results);
  }
}

interface NationalIDProvider {
  verify(
    idNumber: string, 
    biometricData?: string
  ): Promise<VerificationResult>;

class KenyaNIIMS implements NationalIDProvider {
  async verify(idNumber: string, fingerprint: string) {
    const response = await fetch(process.env.NIIMS_ENDPOINT, {
      method: 'POST',
      body: JSON.stringify({
        huduma_number: idNumber,
        biometric_data: fingerprint
      }),
      headers: { 'Authorization': `Bearer ${process.env.NIIMS_API_KEY}` }
    });
    return response.json();
  }

export function getIdVerifier(countryCode: string): NationalIDProvider {
  switch (countryCode) {
    case 'KE': return new KenyaNIIMS();
    case 'IN': return new IndiaAadhaar();
    default: throw new Error('Unsupported jurisdiction');
  }
}

// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

contract DAOKYC {
    struct NomadicEntity {
        address[] governanceTokens;
        string legalWrappers; // IPFS hash
        uint256 kycExpiry;
    }
    
    mapping(address => NomadicEntity) public entities;
    
    function registerDAO(
        address[] calldata tokenContracts,
        string calldata legalWrapperCID
    ) external {
        require(tokenContracts.length > 3, "Insufficient governance");
        entities[msg.sender] = NomadicEntity({
            governanceTokens: tokenContracts,
            legalWrappers: legalWrapperCID,
            kycExpiry: block.timestamp + 365 days
        });
    }
    
    function verifyDAO(address dao) public view returns (bool) {
        return entities[dao].kycExpiry > block.timestamp;
    }
}

// src/services/nomadic-kyc.ts
export async function verifyNomadicProvider(provider: NomadicProvider) {
  // 1. Check DAO governance tokens
  const daoValid = await blockchain.queryDAOKYC(provider.daoAddress);
  
  // 2. Verify at least 2 jurisdictional wrappers
  const jurisdictions = await couchbase.query(
    `SELECT DISTINCT jurisdiction 
     FROM legal_wrappers 
     WHERE daoAddress = $1`,
    [provider.daoAddress]
  );
  
  // 3. Dynamic risk scoring
  const riskScore = calculateRiskScore(
    daoValid,
    jurisdictions.length,
    provider.txnVolume
  );
  
  return riskScore < 0.7; // Accept if below threshold
}

3. Biometric Verification Pipeline

A. Liveness Detection Microservice

# biometrics/liveness.py
from deepface import DeepFace
import cv2

def verify_liveness(video_path: str) -> bool:
    # 1. Frame extraction
    cap = cv2.VideoCapture(video_path)
    frames = [cap.read()[1] for _ in range(10)]
    
    # 2. Micro-movement analysis
    motion_scores = analyze_motion(frames)
    
    # 3. 3D face mapping
    face_analysis = DeepFace.analyze(
        img_path=frames[0],
        actions=['depth']
    )
    
    return all([
        motion_scores > 0.85,
        face_analysis['depth']['score'] > 0.92
    ])

// src/services/biometric-kyc.ts
export async function processBiometricKYC(
  userId: string,
  idCardImage: Buffer,
  selfieVideo: Buffer
) {
  // 1. Liveness check
  const isLive = await livenessService.check(selfieVideo);
  if (!isLive) throw new Error('Liveness check failed');
  
  // 2. Face matching
  const matchResult = await faceMatch(idCardImage, selfieVideo);
  
  // 3. Store encrypted biometric hash
  const bioHash = hashBiometricData(selfieVideo);
  await privateChain.storeProof(
    `biometric::${userId}`,
    bioHash,
    matchResult.confidence
  );
  
  // 4. Issue VC
  return issueVerifiableCredential({
    type: 'biometric_kyc',
    confidence: matchResult.confidence,
    provider: 'YetuPayLivenessAI'
  });
}

  participantJurisdictions: string[],

): ComplianceResult {

  );
  
  // 2. Detect conflicts
  const conflicts = findLawConflicts(applicableLaws);

B. Smart Contract Enforcement

solidity
Copy
Download
// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

contract CrossBorderCompliance {
    struct TransactionPolicy {
        uint256 minKycLevel;
        bool requireTravelRule;
        string[] bannedJurisdictions;
    }
    
    mapping(bytes32 => TransactionPolicy) public policies;
    
    function checkCompliance(
        address participant,
        string memory fromJurisdiction,
        string memory toJurisdiction
    ) public view returns (bool) {
        bytes32 policyKey = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(
            fromJurisdiction, 
            toJurisdiction
        ));
        
        TransactionPolicy memory policy = policies[policyKey];
        
        // Check participant meets minimum KYC
        if(ParticipantKYC(participant).kycLevel() < policy.minKycLevel) {
            return false;
        }
        
        // Check against banned jurisdictions
        for(uint i=0; i<policy.bannedJurisdictions.length; i++) {
            if(keccak256(bytes(toJurisdiction)) == 
               keccak256(bytes(policy.bannedJurisdictions[i]))) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        
        return true;
    }
}

B. Self-Learning Country Detector

python
Copy
Download
# src/algorithms/country_detector.py
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

class CountryDetector:
    def __init__(self):
        self.model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100)
        self.features = [
            'length', 'has_letters', 
            'prefix_matches', 'checksum_valid'
        ]
    
    async def train(self, db_connection):
        # Get historical validation data
        data = await db_connection.query(
            "SELECT id_value, country_code FROM id_validation_logs"
        )
        
        # Feature engineering
        X = np.array([self._extract_features(x[0]) for x in data])
        y = np.array([x[1] for x in data])
        
        self.model.fit(X, y)
    
    def _extract_features(self, id_value):
        return [
            len(id_value),                         # length
            any(c.isalpha() for c in id_value),    # has_letters
            self._check_prefixes(id_value),        # prefix_matches
            self._validate_checksum(id_value)      # checksum_valid
        ]
    
    def predict(self, id_value):
        features = self._extract_features(id_value)
        return self.model.predict([features])[0]

C. Reusable Validation Engine

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/services/id-validator.ts
export class NationalIDValidator {
  private templates: Map<string, CountryTemplate>;
  
  constructor(private couchbase: CouchbaseClient) {
    this.loadTemplates();
  }
  
  async validate(idValue: string): Promise<ValidationResult> {
    // 1. Auto-detect country
    const countryCode = await this.detectCountry(idValue);
    
    // 2. Get template
    const template = await this.getTemplate(countryCode);
    
    // 3. Validate against rules
    const errors = this.checkRules(idValue, template);
    
    // 4. Store for learning
    await this.recordValidation(idValue, countryCode, errors.length === 0);
    
    return {
      isValid: errors.length === 0,
      countryCode,
      errors
    };
  }
  
  private async detectCountry(idValue: string): Promise<string> {
    // Try ML model first
    try {
      return await countryDetector.predict(idValue);
    } catch {
      // Fallback to rule-based matching
      return this.ruleBasedDetection(idValue);
    }
  }
}

    await this.loadTemplate();
  },
  methods: {

      const res = await fetch(`/api/id-templates/${this.selectedCountry}`);
      this.template = await res.json();
    },
    async saveTemplate() {
      await fetch(`/api/id-templates/${this.selectedCountry}`, {
        method: 'PUT',
        body: JSON.stringify(this.template)
      });
    }
  }

4. Continuous Learning System

A. Feedback Loop Implementation

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/jobs/learning-updater.ts
export async function updateLearningModels() {
  // 1. Get recent validation data
  const data = await couchbase.query(`
    SELECT id_value, country_code, is_valid 
    FROM id_validation_logs 
    WHERE timestamp > DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)`);
  
  // 2. Retrain country detector
  await countryDetector.train(data);
  
  // 3. Update template weights
  await updateTemplateWeights(data);
}

async function updateTemplateWeights(data) {
  // Analyze which rules most frequently catch errors
  const ruleEffectiveness = await analyzeRulePerformance();
  
  // Update template learning weights
  for (const [country, stats] of Object.entries(ruleEffectiveness)) {
    await couchbase.query(`
      UPDATE id_templates 
      SET meta.learning_weights = $1 
      WHERE country_code = $2`,
      [stats.weights, country]
    );
  }
}

B. Rule Performance Analytics

sql
Copy
Download
-- N1QL Query for Rule Effectiveness
SELECT 
  country_code,
  ARRAY_AGG(DISTINCT error_type) AS common_errors,
  COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE is_valid = false) / COUNT(*) AS error_rate,
  OBJECT_UPDATE(meta.learning_weights, 
    'length_importance', 
    CASE WHEN LENGTH(id_value) = validation_rules.id_length 
         THEN meta.learning_weights.length_importance * 0.9
         ELSE meta.learning_weights.length_importance * 1.1 END
  ) AS new_weights
FROM id_validation_logs
GROUP BY country_code

// controllers/kycController.js
import { anchorToBlockchain, verifyParticipant } from '../services/blockchain';

export const registerParticipant = async (req, res) => {
  const { participantType, documents } = req.body;
  
  // 1. Validate documents
  const validation = await verifyDocuments(participantType, documents);
  
  // 2. Store in Couchbase
  const docId = await storeKYCDocuments(validation);
  
  // 3. Anchor to blockchain
  const txHash = await anchorToBlockchain({
    docId,
    participantType,
    validationStatus: validation.valid
  });
  
  res.json({
    kycId: docId,
    blockchainProof: txHash,
    tier: determineTier(participantType)
  });
};

export const verifyParticipant = async (req, res) => {
  const { kycId } = req.params;
  
  // 1. Check Couchbase
  const kycDoc = await getKYCDocument(kycId);
  
  // 2. Verify blockchain proof
  const onChainValid = await verifyOnChain(kycDoc.blockchainProof);
  
  res.json({
    valid: kycDoc.validationStatus && onChainValid,
    lastVerified: kycDoc.lastVerified
  });
};

// config/fabricConnection.js
import { Gateway, Wallets } from 'fabric-network';
import fs from 'fs';

export async function connectKYCChannel() {
  const wallet = await Wallets.newFileSystemWallet('./wallet');
  const gateway = new Gateway();
  
  const connectionProfile = JSON.parse(
    fs.readFileSync('./profiles/kyc-connection.json', 'utf8')
  );

  await gateway.connect(connectionProfile, {
    wallet,
    identity: 'kyc-service',
    discovery: { enabled: true, asLocalhost: false }
  });

  return gateway.getNetwork('kyc-channel');
}

B. Smart Contract Interactions

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/blockchain.js
const { connectKYCChannel } = require('../config/fabricConnection');

export const anchorToBlockchain = async (kycData) => {
  const network = await connectKYCChannel();
  const contract = network.getContract('kyc-contract');
  
  const tx = await contract.submitTransaction(
    'CreateKYCRecord',
    JSON.stringify(kycData)
  );
  
  return tx.toString('hex');
};

export const verifyOnChain = async (txHash) => {
  const network = await connectKYCChannel();
  const contract = network.getContract('kyc-contract');
  
  const result = await contract.evaluateTransaction(
    'VerifyKYCRecord',
    txHash
  );
  
  return JSON.parse(result.toString()).valid;
};

// gateway/authMiddleware.js
import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';
import { verifyDID } from '../blockchain/did';

export const authenticateService = (req, res, next) => {
  // 1. Check JWT from service mesh
  const token = req.headers['x-service-token'];
  
  // 2. Verify blockchain DID
  const did = jwt.verify(token, process.env.SERVICE_SECRET).did;
  const valid = verifyDID(did);
  
  if (!valid) return res.status(401).end();
  
  next();
};

// utils/serviceIdentity.js
import { DID } from 'did-ethr';
import { createSigner } from 'did-jwt';

export const generateServiceDID = () => {
  const did = new DID({
    provider: process.env.BLOCKCHAIN_RPC,
    registry: process.env.DID_REGISTRY
  });
  
  return did.create();
};

export const generateServiceToken = (did) => {
  return createSigner(did).jwt({
    aud: 'yetupay-services',
    exp: Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000) + 300 // 5min expiry
  });
};

B. Blockchain-Enforced Access Control

solidity
Copy
Download
// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;

contract ServiceRegistry {
    struct Microservice {
        address didAddress;
        bytes32 publicKey;
        string[] allowedEndpoints;
        uint256 lastRenewal;
    }
    
    mapping(string => Microservice) public services;
    
    function verifyAccess(
        string memory serviceName,
        string memory endpoint
    ) public view returns (bool) {
        Microservice memory s = services[serviceName];
        if (s.lastRenewal < block.timestamp - 30 days) return false;
        
        for (uint i=0; i<s.allowedEndpoints.length; i++) {
            if (keccak256(bytes(s.allowedEndpoints[i])) == 
               keccak256(bytes(endpoint))) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }
}

Now lets look at database choice selection, we should have an adapter from which we can choose which database management system to use so that we are not confined to a particular database management system. It means that we should offer a flexible choice and have a configurable API adapter to connect to either RDMS(sql or Mysql) or NRDMS(NoSQL) in noSql we only offer couchbase because of its sql-like N1QL and ottoman

YetuPay Database Abstraction Layer (DAL)

Let's design a flexible database adapter system that supports multiple SQL and NoSQL databases with a unified query interface, focusing on Couchbase as our primary NoSQL option due to its N1QL capabilities.

2. Core Implementation

A. Adapter Interface (TypeScript)

// src/interfaces/IDatabaseAdapter.ts
interface IDatabaseAdapter {
  connect(config: DatabaseConfig): Promise<void>;
  query<T = any>(query: string, params?: any[]): Promise<T[]>;
  execute(statement: string, params?: any[]): Promise<number>;
  disconnect(): Promise<void>;
}

type DatabaseConfig = {
  type: 'couchbase' | 'postgresql' | 'mysql';
  host: string;
  port: number;
  username?: string;
  password?: string;
  bucket?: string; // For Couchbase
  database?: string; // For SQL
};

B. Couchbase Implementation

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/adapters/CouchbaseAdapter.ts
import { Bucket, Cluster, N1qlQuery } from 'couchbase';
import { IDatabaseAdapter } from '../interfaces/IDatabaseAdapter';

export class CouchbaseAdapter implements IDatabaseAdapter {
  private cluster!: Cluster;
  private bucket!: Bucket;

  async connect(config: DatabaseConfig) {
    this.cluster = await Cluster.connect(config.host, {
      username: config.username,
      password: config.password
    });
    this.bucket = this.cluster.bucket(config.bucket!);
  }

  async query<T = any>(query: string, params?: any[]): Promise<T[]> {
    const q = N1qlQuery.fromString(query);
    const result = await this.bucket.query(q, { parameters: params });
    return result.rows as T[];
  }

  async disconnect() {
    await this.cluster.close();
  }
}

import { IDatabaseAdapter } from '../interfaces/IDatabaseAdapter';

export class PostgresAdapter implements IDatabaseAdapter {
  private pool!: Pool;

  async connect(config: DatabaseConfig) {
    this.pool = new Pool({
      host: config.host,
      port: config.port,
      user: config.username,
      password: config.password,
      database: config.database
    });
  }

  async query<T = any>(query: string, params?: any[]): Promise<T[]> {
    const result = await this.pool.query(query, params);
    return result.rows;
  }

  async disconnect() {
    await this.pool.end();
  }
}

4. Database Factory

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/db/factory.ts
import { CouchbaseAdapter } from '../adapters/CouchbaseAdapter';
import { PostgresAdapter } from '../adapters/PostgresAdapter';
import { MySqlAdapter } from '../adapters/MySqlAdapter';
import { IDatabaseAdapter } from '../interfaces/IDatabaseAdapter';

export function createDatabaseAdapter(
  type: 'couchbase' | 'postgresql' | 'mysql'
): IDatabaseAdapter {
  switch (type) {
    case 'couchbase':
      return new CouchbaseAdapter();
    case 'postgresql':
      return new PostgresAdapter();
    case 'mysql':
      return new MySqlAdapter(); // Similar to Postgres
    default:
      throw new Error(`Unsupported database type: ${type}`);
  }
}

// Singleton database instance
let dbAdapter: IDatabaseAdapter;

export async function getDatabaseAdapter(): Promise<IDatabaseAdapter> {
  if (!dbAdapter) {
    const dbType = process.env.DB_TYPE as 'couchbase' | 'postgresql' | 'mysql';
    dbAdapter = createDatabaseAdapter(dbType);
    
    await dbAdapter.connect({
      type: dbType,
      host: process.env.DB_HOST!,
      port: parseInt(process.env.DB_PORT!),
      username: process.env.DB_USER,
      password: process.env.DB_PASS,
      bucket: process.env.CB_BUCKET,
      database: process.env.DB_NAME
    });
  }
  return dbAdapter;
}

5. N1QL/SQL Query Builder

typescript
Copy
Download
// src/db/queryBuilder.ts
class QueryBuilder {
  private dbType: string;
  private query: string = '';
  private params: any[] = [];

  constructor(dbType: string) {
    this.dbType = dbType;
  }

  select(fields: string): this {
    this.query += `SELECT ${fields}`;
    return this;
  }

  from(table: string): this {
    if (this.dbType === 'couchbase') {
      this.query += ` FROM \`${table}\``;
    } else {
      this.query += ` FROM ${table}`;
    }
    return this;
  }

  where(condition: string, ...params: any[]): this {
    this.query += ` WHERE ${condition}`;
    this.params.push(...params);
    return this;
  }

  async execute<T>(): Promise<T[]> {
    const db = await getDatabaseAdapter();
    return db.query<T>(this.query, this.params);
  }
}

export function query(dbType: string = process.env.DB_TYPE!) {
  return new QueryBuilder(dbType);
}

Copy
Download
// db/adapters/couchbase-adapter.js
const { Cluster, Bucket, N1qlQuery } = require('couchbase');
const { Ottoman } = require('ottoman');
const DatabaseAdapter = require('./base-adapter');

class CouchbaseAdapter extends DatabaseAdapter {
  constructor() {
    super();
    this.ottoman = new Ottoman({
      collectionName: '_default',
      scopeName: '_default'
    });
  }

  async connect(config) {
    this.cluster = await Cluster.connect(config.host, {
      username: config.username,
      password: config.password
    });
    this.bucket = this.cluster.bucket(config.bucket);
    await this.ottoman.connect(this.cluster);
  }

  async query(sql, params = []) {
    const query = N1qlQuery.fromString(sql);
    const result = await this.bucket.query(query, { parameters: params });
    return result.rows;
  }

  async disconnect() {
    await this.cluster.close();
  }

  // Ottoman-specific methods
  defineModel(name, schema) {
    return this.ottoman.model(name, schema);
  }
}

module.exports = CouchbaseAdapter;

  }
}

We also need an adapter for the quoting service which should handle the systems charges and the charges offered by the players. The service provided by the API resource /quotes is calculation of possible fees and FSP commission involved in performing an interoperable financial transaction. Both the Payer and Payee FSP should calculate their part of the quote to be able to get a total view of all the fees and FSP commission involved in the transaction and the Straight through processing rates charged by the yetupay system

YetuPay Quoting Service Adapter

Here's a comprehensive JavaScript implementation for a quoting service that calculates fees, commissions, and STP rates across all participants in a transaction:

1. Quote Service Architecture

Diagram
Code
Download
Mermaid rendering failed.

2. Core Quote Adapter Implementation

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/quote-adapter.js
const { getDatabaseAdapter } = require('../db/factory');
const { query } = require('../db/query-builder');
const { anchorToBlockchain } = require('../blockchain');

class QuoteService {
  constructor() {
    this.feeCache = new Map(); // For caching FSP fee schedules
  }

  async calculateQuote(transaction) {
    // 1. Get payer FSP fees
    const payerFees = await this.getFspFees(
      transaction.payerFspId, 
      'debit'
    );

    // 2. Get payee FSP fees
    const payeeFees = await this.getFspFees(
      transaction.payeeFspId, 
      'credit'
    );

    // 3. Calculate YetuPay STP fee
    const yetuPayFee = this.calculateYetuPayFee(transaction);

    // 4. Build complete quote
    const quote = {
      transactionId: transaction.id,
      payerFspFees: payerFees,
      payeeFspFees: payeeFees,
      yetuPayFee: yetuPayFee,
      totalFees: this.sumFees(payerFees, payeeFees, yetuPayFee),
      expiration: new Date(Date.now() + 300000), // 5 min expiry
      timestamp: new Date()
    };

    // 5. Anchor to blockchain for non-repudiation
    const txHash = await anchorToBlockchain(
      'quotes',
      JSON.stringify(quote)
    );

    return { ...quote, blockchainProof: txHash };
  }

  async getFspFees(fspId, direction) {
    // Check cache first
    if (this.feeCache.has(`${fspId}_${direction}`)) {
      return this.feeCache.get(`${fspId}_${direction}`);
    }

    // Query database
    const fees = await query()
      .select('fee_structure')
      .from('fsp_fee_schedules')
      .where('fsp_id = $1 AND direction = $2', [fspId, direction])
      .execute();

    if (fees.length === 0) {
      throw new Error(`No fee schedule found for FSP ${fspId}`);
    }

    // Cache the result
    this.feeCache.set(`${fspId}_${direction}`, fees[0].fee_structure);
    return fees[0].fee_structure;
  }

  calculateYetuPayFee(transaction) {
    // STP (Straight Through Processing) fee logic
    const baseFee = 0.005; // 0.5%
    const minFee = 10; // Minimum fee in transaction currency
    const calculatedFee = transaction.amount * baseFee;
    
    return {
      description: 'YetuPay STP Fee',
      amount: Math.max(calculatedFee, minFee),
      currency: transaction.currency,
      feeType: 'percentage',
      rate: baseFee * 100
    };
  }

  sumFees(...feeStructures) {
    return feeStructures.reduce((total, fees) => {
      return total + (fees.amount || 0);
    }, 0);
  }
}

module.exports = new QuoteService();

5. Blockchain Anchoring

javascript
Copy
Download
// blockchain/anchor-service.js
const { connectKYCChannel } = require('./fabric-connection');

async function anchorToBlockchain(collection, data) {
  const network = await connectKYCChannel();
  const contract = network.getContract('yetupay-contract');
  
  const tx = await contract.submitTransaction(
    'CreateRecord',
    collection,
    JSON.stringify(data)
  );
  
  return tx.toString('hex');
}

async function verifyQuote(txHash) {
  const network = await connectKYCChannel();
  const contract = network.getContract('yetupay-contract');
  
  const result = await contract.evaluateTransaction(
    'VerifyRecord',
    txHash
  );
  
  return JSON.parse(result.toString());
}

module.exports = {
  anchorToBlockchain,
  verifyQuote
};

6. Fee Calculation Rules Engine

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/rules-engine.js
class RulesEngine {
  constructor() {
    this.rules = new Map();
    this.loadDefaultRules();
  }

  loadDefaultRules() {
    // Add default rules
    this.addRule('cross-border', (tx) => {
      return tx.senderCountry !== tx.receiverCountry;
    });
    
    this.addRule('high-value', (tx) => {
      return tx.amount > 10000;
    });
  }

  addRule(name, evaluator) {
    this.rules.set(name, evaluator);
  }

  evaluateTransaction(transaction) {
    const applicableRules = [];
    
    for (const [name, rule] of this.rules) {
      if (rule(transaction)) {
        applicableRules.push(name);
      }
    }
    
    return applicableRules;
  }

  applyFeeAdjustments(baseFee, rules) {
    let adjustedFee = baseFee;
    
    if (rules.includes('cross-border')) {
      adjustedFee *= 1.5; // 50% higher for cross-border
    }
    
    if (rules.includes('high-value')) {
      adjustedFee = Math.max(adjustedFee, 50); // Min fee for high-value
    }
    
    return adjustedFee;
  }
}

module.exports = new RulesEngine();

7. Enhanced Quote Calculation with Rules

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/quote-adapter.js (extended)
const rulesEngine = require('./rules-engine');

class QuoteService {
  // ... previous code ...

  async calculateYetuPayFee(transaction) {
    const baseFeeRate = 0.005; // 0.5% base
    const minFee = 10;
    
    // Evaluate special rules
    const applicableRules = rulesEngine.evaluateTransaction(transaction);
    const adjustedRate = rulesEngine.applyFeeAdjustments(baseFeeRate, applicableRules);
    
    const calculatedFee = transaction.amount * adjustedRate;
    
    return {
      description: 'YetuPay STP Fee',
      amount: Math.max(calculatedFee, minFee),
      currency: transaction.currency,
      feeType: 'percentage',
      rate: adjustedRate * 100,
      appliedRules: applicableRules
    };
  }
}

// services/quote-analytics.js
const { query } = require('../db/query-builder');

class QuoteAnalytics {
  async getHistoricalQuotes(fspId, days = 30) {
    return query()
      .select('*')
      .from('quotes')
      .where('(payerFspId = $1 OR payeeFspId = $1) AND timestamp >= $2', [
        fspId,
        new Date(Date.now() - days * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000)
      ])
      .execute();
  }

  async calculateAverageFees(fspId) {
    const results = await query()
      .select(`
        AVG(payerFspFees.calculated_amount) as avg_payer_fee,
        AVG(payeeFspFees.calculated_amount) as avg_payee_fee,
        AVG(yetuPayFee.amount) as avg_stp_fee
      `)
      .from('quotes')
      .where('payerFspId = $1 OR payeeFspId = $1', [fspId])
      .execute();

    return results[0];
  }

  async generateMonthlyReport() {
    return query()
      .select(`
        DATE_TRUNC('month', timestamp) as month,
        COUNT(*) as quote_count,
        SUM(totalFees) as total_fees
      `)
      .from('quotes')
      .groupBy('month')
      .orderBy('month')
      .execute();
  }
}

module.exports = new QuoteAnalytics();

2. Bulk Quote Processing

A. Bulk Quote Processor

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/bulk-quote-processor.js
const quoteService = require('./quote-adapter');
const { anchorToBlockchain } = require('../blockchain/anchor-service');

class BulkQuoteProcessor {
  async processBulkQuotes(transactions, batchSize = 10) {
    const results = [];
    const batches = this.createBatches(transactions, batchSize);

    for (const batch of batches) {
      const batchResults = await Promise.all(
        batch.map(txn => quoteService.calculateQuote(txn))
      );
      results.push(...batchResults);

      // Anchor each batch to blockchain
      const batchTxHash = await anchorToBlockchain(
        'bulk_quotes',
        JSON.stringify(batchResults)
      );
      
      batchResults.forEach(result => {
        result.bulkBatchProof = batchTxHash;
      });
    }

    return results;
  }

  createBatches(array, size) {
    const batches = [];
    for (let i = 0; i < array.length; i += size) {
      batches.push(array.slice(i, i + size));
    }
    return batches;
  }
}

module.exports = new BulkQuoteProcessor();

// models/fee-agreement.model.js
const { Schema } = require('ottoman');
const BaseModel = require('./base-model');

class FeeAgreement extends BaseModel {
  static modelName = 'FeeAgreement';
  static schema = new Schema({
    fspId: { type: String, required: true },
    counterpartyId: { type: String, required: true },
    agreementType: { type: String, enum: ['bilateral', 'discount', 'tiered'] },
    terms: { type: Object, required: true },
    startDate: { type: Date, required: true },
    endDate: { type: Date },
    isActive: { type: Boolean, default: true }
  });

  static async getActiveAgreements(fspId) {
    const Model = this.initModel();
    return Model.find({
      $or: [{ fspId }, { counterpartyId: fspId }],
      isActive: true,
      $or: [
        { endDate: { $exists: false } },
        { endDate: { $gt: new Date() } }
      ]
    });
  }
}

B. Agreement-Aware Fee Calculator

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/agreement-fee-calculator.js
const FeeAgreement = require('../models/fee-agreement.model');

class AgreementFeeCalculator {
  async applyAgreements(fspId, counterpartyId, baseFees) {
    const agreements = await FeeAgreement.getActiveAgreements(fspId);
    let adjustedFees = { ...baseFees };

    for (const agreement of agreements) {
      if (agreement.counterpartyId === counterpartyId || 
          agreement.fspId === counterpartyId) {
        adjustedFees = this.applyAgreementTerms(adjustedFees, agreement.terms);
      }
    }

    return adjustedFees;
  }

  applyAgreementTerms(fees, terms) {
    switch (terms.type) {
      case 'percentage_discount':
        return {
          ...fees,
          percentage_fee: fees.percentage_fee * (1 - terms.discount / 100)
        };
      case 'fixed_discount':
        return {
          ...fees,
          fixed_fee: Math.max(0, fees.fixed_fee - terms.discount)
        };
      case 'tiered':
        return this.applyTieredPricing(fees, terms.tiers);
      default:
        return fees;
    }
  }
}

module.exports = new AgreementFeeCalculator();

4. Real-Time Fee Schedule Updates

A. WebSocket Update Service

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/fee-update-service.js
const WebSocket = require('ws');
const FeeAgreement = require('../models/fee-agreement.model');

class FeeUpdateService {
  constructor(server) {
    this.wss = new WebSocket.Server({ server });
    this.subscriptions = new Map();
    
    this.wss.on('connection', (ws, req) => {
      const fspId = req.headers['fsp-id'];
      this.subscriptions.set(fspId, ws);
      
      ws.on('close', () => this.subscriptions.delete(fspId));
    });
  }

  async notifyFeeUpdate(fspId) {
    const ws = this.subscriptions.get(fspId);
    if (ws) {
      const agreements = await FeeAgreement.getActiveAgreements(fspId);
      ws.send(JSON.stringify({
        type: 'fee_schedule_update',
        data: agreements
      }));
    }
  }

  broadcastSystemUpdate() {
    this.wss.clients.forEach(client => {
      if (client.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
        client.send(JSON.stringify({
          type: 'system_update',
          message: 'Fee schedules may have changed'
        }));
      }
    });
  }
}

module.exports = FeeUpdateService;

    return this.buildCompleteQuote(
      transaction,
      adjustedPayerFees,
      adjustedPayeeFees,
      yetuPayFee
    );
  }
}

// services/analytics-dashboard.js
const { query } = require('../db/query-builder');
const { generateChartData } = require('./chart-utils');

class AnalyticsDashboard {
  async getFeeTrends(fspId, period = '30d') {
    const interval = this.resolveInterval(period);
    
    const data = await query()
      .select(`
        DATE_TRUNC('${interval}', timestamp) as time_bucket,
        AVG(payerFspFees.calculated_amount) as avg_payer_fee,
        AVG(payeeFspFees.calculated_amount) as avg_payee_fee,
        AVG(yetuPayFee.amount) as avg_stp_fee
      `)
      .from('quotes')
      .where('(payerFspId = $1 OR payeeFspId = $1) AND timestamp >= $2', [
        fspId,
        this.getDateCutoff(period)
      ])
      .groupBy('time_bucket')
      .orderBy('time_bucket')
      .execute();

    return {
      chartData: generateChartData(data, {
        xAxis: 'time_bucket',
        series: ['avg_payer_fee', 'avg_payee_fee', 'avg_stp_fee']
      }),
      rawData: data
    };
  }

  async getFspComparisonMetrics() {
    return query()
      .select(`
        fsp_id,
        COUNT(*) as transaction_count,
        AVG(totalFees) as avg_total_fee,
        SUM(totalFees) as revenue
      `)
      .from('fsp_performance')
      .groupBy('fsp_id')
      .execute();
  }

  resolveInterval(period) {
    return {
      '7d': 'hour',
      '30d': 'day',
      '90d': 'week',
      '1y': 'month'
    }[period] || 'day';
  }

  getDateCutoff(period) {
    const days = parseInt(period);
    return isNaN(days) ? new Date(Date.now() - 30 * 86400000) 
                      : new Date(Date.now() - days * 86400000);
  }
}

module.exports = new AnalyticsDashboard();

B. Chart Generation Utility

// utils/chart-utils.js
function generateChartData(data, config) {
  const result = {
    labels: [],
    datasets: []
  };

  // Add labels (x-axis)
  result.labels = data.map(item => {
    const date = new Date(item[config.xAxis]);
    return config.xAxis.includes('time') ? date.toLocaleDateString() : date;
  });

  // Add datasets
  config.series.forEach(series => {
    result.datasets.push({
      label: series.replace('_', ' ').toUpperCase(),
      data: data.map(item => item[series]),
      backgroundColor: this.getColor(series)
    });
  });

  return result;
}

function getColor(series) {
  const colors = {
    'avg_payer_fee': 'rgba(54, 162, 235, 0.6)',
    'avg_payee_fee': 'rgba(255, 99, 132, 0.6)',
    'avg_stp_fee': 'rgba(75, 192, 192, 0.6)'
  };
  return colors[series] || 'rgba(153, 102, 255, 0.6)';
}

module.exports = { generateChartData };

2. Bulk Processing Failure Recovery

A. Resilient Bulk Processor

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/resilient-bulk-processor.js
const { anchorToBlockchain } = require('../blockchain/anchor-service');

class ResilientBulkProcessor {
  constructor(maxRetries = 3) {
    this.maxRetries = maxRetries;
    this.failedBatches = [];
  }

  async processWithRetry(batch, attempt = 1) {
    try {
      const results = await Promise.all(
        batch.map(txn => quoteService.calculateQuote(txn))
      );
      
      const txHash = await anchorToBlockchain(
        'bulk_quotes',
        JSON.stringify(results)
      );
      
      return { results, txHash };
    } catch (error) {
      if (attempt >= this.maxRetries) {
        this.failedBatches.push({ batch, error });
        throw error;
      }
      await this.delay(1000 * attempt);
      return this.processWithRetry(batch, attempt + 1);
    }
  }

  async processBulkQuotes(transactions) {
    const batchSize = 10;
    const results = [];
    
    for (let i = 0; i < transactions.length; i += batchSize) {
      const batch = transactions.slice(i, i + batchSize);
      
      try {
        const { results: batchResults, txHash } = 
          await this.processWithRetry(batch);
        
        batchResults.forEach(r => { r.bulkBatchProof = txHash; });
        results.push(...batchResults);
      } catch (error) {
        console.error(`Failed batch starting at index ${i}:`, error);
      }
    }

    return {
      successful: results,
      failed: this.failedBatches,
      successRate: results.length / transactions.length
    };
  }

  delay(ms) {
    return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
  }
}

module.exports = new ResilientBulkProcessor();

// models/versioned-agreement.model.js
const { Schema } = require('ottoman');
const BaseModel = require('./base-model');

class VersionedAgreement extends BaseModel {
  static modelName = 'VersionedAgreement';
  static schema = new Schema({
    agreementId: { type: String, required: true },
    version: { type: Number, required: true },
    previousVersion: { type: Number },
    fspId: { type: String, required: true },
    counterpartyId: { type: String, required: true },
    terms: { type: Object, required: true },
    effectiveDate: { type: Date, required: true },
    endDate: { type: Date },
    isActive: { type: Boolean, default: true },
    createdBy: { type: String, required: true },
    changeReason: { type: String }
  });

  static async getAgreementHistory(agreementId) {
    const Model = this.initModel();
    return Model.find({ agreementId }).sort({ version: -1 });
  }

  static async getActiveVersion(agreementId) {
    const Model = this.initModel();
    return Model.findOne({ 
      agreementId, 
      isActive: true,
      $or: [
        { endDate: { $exists: false } },
        { endDate: { $gt: new Date() } }
      ]
    }).sort({ version: -1 });
  }
}

module.exports = VersionedAgreement;

B. Agreement Version Manager

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/agreement-version-manager.js
const VersionedAgreement = require('../models/versioned-agreement.model');
const { anchorToBlockchain } = require('../blockchain/anchor-service');

class AgreementVersionManager {
  async createNewVersion(agreementData) {
    // Get current version
    const current = await VersionedAgreement.getActiveVersion(agreementData.agreementId);
    const newVersion = current ? current.version + 1 : 1;

    // Create new version
    const newAgreement = new VersionedAgreement({
      ...agreementData,
      version: newVersion,
      previousVersion: current?.version,
      effectiveDate: new Date()
    });

    // Deactivate old version if exists
    if (current) {
      current.isActive = false;
      await current.save();
    }

    // Save and anchor new version
    await newAgreement.save();
    await anchorToBlockchain(
      'agreement_versions',
      JSON.stringify(newAgreement)
    );

    return newAgreement;
  }

  async rollbackVersion(agreementId, targetVersion) {
    const versions = await VersionedAgreement.getAgreementHistory(agreementId);
    const target = versions.find(v => v.version === targetVersion);
    
    if (!target) throw new Error('Target version not found');

    // Create new version based on target
    return this.createNewVersion({
      ...target.toObject(),
      changeReason: `Rollback to version ${targetVersion}`
    });
  }
}

module.exports = new AgreementVersionManager();

4. WebSocket Security Hardening

A. Secure WebSocket Service

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/secure-websocket.js
const WebSocket = require('ws');
const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken');
const { verifyDID } = require('../blockchain/did');

class SecureWebSocketService {
  constructor(server) {
    this.wss = new WebSocket.Server({
      server,
      verifyClient: (info, done) => {
        this.authenticateConnection(info.req)
          .then(valid => done(valid))
          .catch(() => done(false));
      }
    });
    
    this.setupEventHandlers();
  }

  async authenticateConnection(req) {
    try {
      const token = req.headers['sec-websocket-protocol'];
      const decoded = jwt.verify(token, process.env.JWT_SECRET);
      return await verifyDID(decoded.did);
    } catch (error) {
      return false;
    }
  }

  setupEventHandlers() {
    this.wss.on('connection', (ws, req) => {
      const fspId = jwt.decode(req.headers['sec-websocket-protocol']).fspId;
      
      // Heartbeat
      const heartbeatInterval = setInterval(() => {
        if (ws.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
          ws.ping();
        }
      }, 30000);

      ws.on('close', () => {
        clearInterval(heartbeatInterval);
        this.cleanupConnection(fspId);
      });

      ws.on('error', (error) => {
        console.error(`WebSocket error for ${fspId}:`, error);
      });
    });
  }

  sendToFsp(fspId, message) {
    this.wss.clients.forEach(client => {
      if (client.fspId === fspId && client.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
        client.send(JSON.stringify(message));
      }
    });
  }

  broadcastToRole(role, message) {
    // Implement role-based broadcasting
  }
}

module.exports = SecureWebSocketService;

B. WebSocket Authentication Middleware

javascript
Copy
Download
// middleware/ws-auth.js
const jwt = require('jsonwebtoken');

function authenticateWebSocket(req, res, next) {
  const token = req.query.token;
  
  if (!token) {
    return res.status(401).json({ error: 'Authentication required' });
  }

  try {
    const decoded = jwt.verify(token, process.env.JWT_SECRET);
    req.fspId = decoded.fspId;
    next();
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(403).json({ error: 'Invalid token' });
  }
}

function generateWebSocketToken(fspId) {
  return jwt.sign(
    { fspId, timestamp: Date.now() },
    process.env.JWT_SECRET,
    { expiresIn: '1h' }
  );
}

module.exports = { authenticateWebSocket, generateWebSocketToken };

Cross-Network Payments & Interoperability Layer

2. Interoperability Layer Components

A. Network Router Service

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/network-router.js
const { query } = require('../db/query-builder');
const { anchorToBlockchain } = require('../blockchain/anchor-service');

class NetworkRouter {
  async resolveNetwork(accountId) {
    // Check cache first
    if (this.accountCache.has(accountId)) {
      return this.accountCache.get(accountId);
    }

    // Query directory service
    const result = await query()
      .select('network_provider, account_type')
      .from('account_directory')
      .where('account_id = $1', [accountId])
      .execute();

    if (result.length === 0) {
      throw new Error('Account not found in directory');
    }

    // Cache the result
    this.accountCache.set(accountId, result[0]);
    return result[0];
  }

  async routePayment(paymentRequest) {
    // 1. Resolve networks
    const payerNetwork = await this.resolveNetwork(paymentRequest.payerId);
    const payeeNetwork = await this.resolveNetwork(paymentRequest.payeeId);

    // 2. Get connector for each network
    const payerConnector = this.getNetworkConnector(payerNetwork.network_provider);
    const payeeConnector = this.getNetworkConnector(payeeNetwork.network_provider);

    // 3. Validate accounts
    await payerConnector.validateAccount(paymentRequest.payerId);
    await payeeConnector.validateAccount(paymentRequest.payeeId);

    // 4. Calculate fees
    const fees = await this.calculateCrossNetworkFees(
      payerNetwork,
      payeeNetwork,
      paymentRequest.amount
    );

    // 5. Return routing information
    return {
      payerNetwork,
      payeeNetwork,
      fees,
      routingPath: this.buildRoutingPath(payerNetwork, payeeNetwork),
      timestamp: new Date()
    };
  }

  getNetworkConnector(provider) {
    const connectors = {
      'mpesa': require('../connectors/mpesa'),
      'mtn': require('../connectors/mtn'),
      'equity': require('../connectors/equity-bank')
    };
    return new connectors[provider]();
  }
}

module.exports = new NetworkRouter();

B. Mobile Money Connector (M-Pesa Example)

javascript
Copy
Download
// connectors/mpesa.js
const axios = require('axios');

class MpesaConnector {
  async validateAccount(accountId) {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get(
        `https://api.mpesa.com/v1/accounts/${accountId}/validate`,
        {
          headers: this.getAuthHeaders()
        }
      );
      return response.data;
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`MPesa validation failed: ${error.message}`);
    }
  }

  async initiatePayment(request) {
    // MPesa STK Push implementation
    const payload = {
      phoneNumber: request.accountId,
      amount: request.amount,
      reference: request.reference
    };

    const response = await axios.post(
      'https://api.mpesa.com/v1/payments/initiate',
      payload,
      { headers: this.getAuthHeaders() }
    );

    return response.data;
  }

  getAuthHeaders() {
    return {
      'Authorization': `Bearer ${process.env.MPESA_API_KEY}`,
      'Content-Type': 'application/json'
    };
  }
}

module.exports = MpesaConnector;

3. Clearing & Settlement Engine

A. Batch Settlement Processor

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/settlement-engine.js
const { query } = require('../db/query-builder');
const { anchorToBlockchain } = require('../blockchain/anchor-service');

class SettlementEngine {
  async processBatch(batchId) {
    // 1. Get pending transactions
    const transactions = await query()
      .select('*')
      .from('pending_transactions')
      .where('batch_id = $1', [batchId])
      .execute();

    // 2. Group by network pairs
    const networkGroups = this.groupByNetworkPairs(transactions);

    // 3. Process each group
    const results = [];
    for (const [networkPair, txs] of Object.entries(networkGroups)) {
      const result = await this.settleNetworkPair(networkPair, txs);
      results.push(result);
    }

    // 4. Anchor settlement proof
    const txHash = await anchorToBlockchain(
      'settlement_batches',
      JSON.stringify({
        batchId,
        timestamp: new Date(),
        results
      })
    );

    return { batchId, txHash, results };
  }

  async settleNetworkPair(networkPair, transactions) {
    const [fromNetwork, toNetwork] = networkPair.split('-');
    const connector = require(`../connectors/${fromNetwork}-to-${toNetwork}`);

    try {
      const result = await connector.settleBatch(transactions);
      await this.markAsSettled(transactions);
      return { success: true, count: transactions.length };
    } catch (error) {
      await this.markAsFailed(transactions);
      return { success: false, error: error.message };
    }
  }
}

module.exports = new SettlementEngine();

A. Web Payment Checkout (React)

javascript
Copy

// WebCheckout.jsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import axios from 'axios';

function WebCheckout() {
  const [amount, setAmount] = useState('');
  const [payerId, setPayerId] = useState('');
  const [payeeId, setPayeeId] = useState('');
  const [quote, setQuote] = useState(null);
  const [paymentStatus, setPaymentStatus] = useState(null);

  const getQuote = async () => {
    const response = await axios.post('/api/quotes', {
      payerId,
      payeeId,
      amount,
      currency: 'KES'
    });
    setQuote(response.data);
  };

  const makePayment = async () => {
    try {
      setPaymentStatus('processing');
      const response = await axios.post('/api/payments', {
        quoteId: quote.transactionId,
        payerId,
        payeeId,
        amount
      });
      setPaymentStatus('success');
    } catch (error) {
      setPaymentStatus('failed');
    }
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <h2>Cross-Network Payment</h2>
      <input
        type="text"
        placeholder="Your phone number"
        value={payerId}
        onChange={(e) => setPayerId(e.target.value)}
      />
      <input
        type="text"
        placeholder="Recipient ID"
        value={payeeId}
        onChange={(e) => setPayeeId(e.target.value)}
      />
      <input
        type="number"
        placeholder="Amount"
        value={amount}
        onChange={(e) => setAmount(e.target.value)}
      />
      <button onClick={getQuote}>Get Quote</button>
      
      {quote && (
        <div>
          <p>Fee: {quote.totalFees}</p>
          <p>Total: {quote.amount + quote.totalFees}</p>
          <button onClick={makePayment}>Pay Now</button>
        </div>
      )}
      
      {paymentStatus === 'success' && <p>Payment successful!</p>}
      {paymentStatus === 'failed' && <p>Payment failed. Please try again.</p>}
    </div>
  );
}

// MerchantService.js
const axios = require('axios');

class MerchantService {
  constructor(apiKey) {
    this.client = axios.create({
      baseURL: 'https://api.yetupay.com/v1',
      headers: { 'Authorization': `Bearer ${apiKey}` }
    });
  }

  async requestPayment(customerId, amount, reference) {
    const response = await this.client.post('/merchant/payments', {
      customerId,
      amount,
      reference,
      currency: 'KES'
    });
    return response.data;
  }

  async checkPaymentStatus(reference) {
    const response = await this.client.get(`/merchant/payments/${reference}`);
    return response.data;
  }
}

// services/monitoring-service.js
const { query } = require('../db/query-builder');

class MonitoringService {
  async getKeyMetrics() {
    const metrics = await query()
      .select(`
        COUNT(*) as total_transactions,
        SUM(amount) as total_volume,
        AVG(processing_time) as avg_processing_time,
        COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE status = 'failed') as failed_count
      `)
      .from('transactions')
      .where('timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL \'24 HOURS\'')
      .execute();

    return metrics[0];
  }

  async getNetworkMetrics() {
    return query()
      .select(`
        payer_network,
        payee_network,
        COUNT(*) as transaction_count,
        AVG(fees) as avg_fee
      `)
      .from('transactions')
      .groupBy('payer_network, payee_network')
      .execute();
  }

  async getRealTimeAlerts() {
    return query()
      .select('*')
      .from('alerts')
      .where('is_resolved = false')
      .orderBy('created_at', 'DESC')
      .execute();
  }
}

module.exports = new MonitoringService();

module.exports = {
  rules: [
    {
      name: 'high-failure-rate',
      condition: `
        SELECT 
          COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE status = 'failed') * 100.0 / COUNT(*) as failure_rate
        FROM transactions
        WHERE timestamp >= NOW() - INTERVAL '1 HOUR'
      `,
      threshold: 5, // Percentage
      severity: 'critical'
    },
    {
      name: 'settlement-delay',
      condition: `
        SELECT AVG(settlement_time - created_at) as avg_delay
        FROM settlements
        WHERE created_at >= NOW() - INTERVAL '1 HOUR'
      `,
      threshold: '30 minutes',
      severity: 'warning'
    }
  ]
};

Simplified Universal Payment Adapter

Let's create a "one-line integration" adapter that makes cross-network payments as simple as calling a single function, while handling all the complexity behind the scenes.

2. Core Simplified Adapter

javascript
Copy
Download
// yetupay-adapter.js
class YetuPay {
  constructor(apiKey) {
    this.apiKey = apiKey;
    this.config = {
      autoSettle: true,
      defaultCurrency: 'KES',
      logLevel: 'error'
    };
  }

  /**
   * One-line payment method
   * @param {string} from - Payer ID (phone, account number)
   * @param {string} to - Payee ID
   * @param {number} amount - Payment amount
   * @param {object} options - Additional options
   */
  async charge(from, to, amount, options = {}) {
    try {
      // 1. Resolve networks
      const networks = await this._resolveNetworks(from, to);
      
      // 2. Get unified quote
      const quote = await this._getQuote({
        from,
        to,
        amount,
        currency: options.currency || this.config.defaultCurrency,
        ...networks
      });

      // 3. Execute payment
      const paymentResult = await this._routePayment(quote);

      // 4. Handle settlement
      if (this.config.autoSettle) {
        await this._settle(paymentResult);
      }

      return {
        success: true,
        transactionId: paymentResult.id,
        fee: quote.fee,
        receipt: paymentResult.receipt
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: error.message,
        code: error.code || 'PAYMENT_FAILED'
      };
    }
  }

  // Internal methods
  async _resolveNetworks(from, to) {
    /* ... */
  }

  async _getQuote(params) {
    /* ... */
  }

  async _routePayment(quote) {
    /* ... */
  }

  async _settle(paymentResult) {
    /* ... */
  }
}

module.exports = YetuPay;

5. Behind-the-Scenes Magic

A. Automatic Network Detection

javascript
Copy
Download
async _resolveNetworks(from, to) {
  // Check cache first
  if (this.networkCache.has(from) && this.networkCache.has(to)) {
    return {
      fromNetwork: this.networkCache.get(from),
      toNetwork: this.networkCache.get(to)
    };
  }

  // Query directory service
  const [fromResult, toResult] = await Promise.all([
    this._queryDirectory(from),
    this._queryDirectory(to)
  ]);

  // Cache results
  this.networkCache.set(from, fromResult.network);
  this.networkCache.set(to, toResult.network);

  return {
    fromNetwork: fromResult.network,
    toNetwork: toResult.network,
    fromType: fromResult.accountType, // 'mobile', 'bank', 'merchant'
    toType: toResult.accountType
  };
}

B. Smart Error Handling

javascript
Copy
Download
async charge(from, to, amount, options) {
  try {
    // ... payment logic ...
  } catch (error) {
    // Convert provider-specific errors to unified codes
    const unifiedError = this._normalizeError(error);
    
    // Log based on configured level
    this._logError(unifiedError);
    
    // Retry for temporary failures
    if (unifiedError.retryable) {
      return this.charge(from, to, amount, options);
    }
    
    throw unifiedError;
  }
}

_normalizeError(error) {
  const errors = {
    'MPESA_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS': {
      code: 'INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS',
      message: 'Your account has insufficient funds',
      retryable: false
    },
    'MTN_NETWORK_ERROR': {
      code: 'NETWORK_UNAVAILABLE',
      message: 'Service temporarily unavailable',
      retryable: true
    }
  };
  
  return errors[error.code] || {
    code: 'UNKNOWN_ERROR',
    message: 'Payment failed',
    retryable: false
  };
}

// server.js - Express middleware
const express = require('express');
const app = express();
const yetupay = require('yetupay-adapter');

app.post('/webhooks', 
  yetupay.webhookVerify('your_webhook_secret'),
  (req, res) => {
    // Verified webhook
    const event = req.body;
    
    switch(event.type) {
      case 'payment.success':
        handleSuccessfulPayment(event);
        break;
      case 'chargeback':
        handleChargeback(event);
        break;
    }
    
    res.status(200).end();

);

  // Update your database

}

3. Webhook Security Best Practices

A. Enhanced Verification Middleware

javascript
Copy
Download
// middleware/webhook-security.js
const crypto = require('crypto');

function verifyWebhook(secret) {
  return (req, res, next) => {
    // 1. Check timestamp freshness (prevent replay attacks)
    const timestamp = req.headers['x-yetupay-timestamp'];
    if (Date.now() - parseInt(timestamp) > 300000) { // 5 minutes
      return res.status(400).send('Stale request');
    }

    // 2. Verify HMAC signature
    const signature = req.headers['x-yetupay-signature'];
    const hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', secret);
    const digest = hmac.update(`${timestamp}.${req.rawBody}`).digest('hex');
    
    if (signature !== digest) {
      return res.status(403).send('Invalid signature');
    }

    // 3. Check idempotency key (prevent duplicate processing)
    const idempotencyKey = req.headers['x-idempotency-key'];
    if (await cache.has(idempotencyKey)) {
      return res.status(409).send('Already processed');
    }
    
    await cache.set(idempotencyKey, 'processed', 86400); // 24h TTL
    
    next();
  };
}

B. Webhook Security Checklist

  1. Always:

    • Validate HMAC signatures

    • Check message freshness

    • Use idempotency keys

    • Log all webhook events

  2. Never:

    • Expose your webhook secret

    • Process without verification

    • Assume payload structure

    • Return sensitive errors

  3. Recommended:

    • IP whitelisting

    • Rate limiting

    • Automatic retry with backoff

    • End-to-end encryption

// services/blockchain-monitor.js
const Web3 = require('web3');

class BlockchainMonitor {
  constructor(networks) {
    this.clients = {};
    this.subscriptions = {};
    
    // Initialize multiple network connections
    networks.forEach(network => {
      this.clients[network.id] = new Web3(network.rpcUrl);
    });
  }

  startMonitoring(addresses, callback) {
    Object.entries(this.clients).forEach(([networkId, web3]) => {
      this.subscriptions[networkId] = web3.eth.subscribe('pendingTransactions', (err, txHash) => {
        if (!err) {
          web3.eth.getTransaction(txHash).then(tx => {
            if (addresses.includes(tx.to) || addresses.includes(tx.from)) {
              callback({
                network: networkId,
                txHash,
                from: tx.from,
                to: tx.to,
                value: web3.utils.fromWei(tx.value),
                timestamp: new Date()
              });
            }
          });
        }
      });
    });
  }

  stopMonitoring() {
    Object.values(this.subscriptions).forEach(sub => sub.unsubscribe());
  }

  async getTransactionRisk(txHash, networkId) {
    // Check with blockchain analytics providers
    const riskData = await Promise.all([
      this._checkWithTRM(txHash),
      this._checkWithChainalysis(txHash)
    ]);
    
    return {
      riskScore: Math.max(...riskData.map(r => r.riskScore)),
      riskIndicators: riskData.flatMap(r => r.indicators)
    };
  }

  async _checkWithTRM(txHash) {
    /* ... */
  }
}

1. Smart Currency Conversion Engine

A. Dynamic Rate Management

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/currency-converter.js
class CurrencyConverter {
  constructor() {
    this.rates = new Map();
    this.providers = [
      new YetuPayRateProvider(),
      new BinanceRateProvider(),
      new ForexAPIRateProvider()
    ];
  }

  async getRate(from, to) {
    const cacheKey = `${from}_${to}`;
    
    // Return cached rate if fresh (<5 minutes old)
    if (this.rates.has(cacheKey)) {
      const { rate, timestamp } = this.rates.get(cacheKey);
      if (Date.now() - timestamp < 300000) return rate;
    }

    // Get best available rate
    const rates = await Promise.allSettled(
      this.providers.map(p => p.getRate(from, to))
    );
    
    const validRates = rates
      .filter(r => r.status === 'fulfilled')
      .map(r => r.value);
    
    if (validRates.length === 0) throw new Error('No rates available');

    // Use median rate for fairness
    const bestRate = this._calculateMedianRate(validRates);
    
    // Cache the rate
    this.rates.set(cacheKey, {
      rate: bestRate,
      timestamp: Date.now()
    });

    return bestRate;
  }

  _calculateMedianRate(rates) {
    const sorted = [...rates].sort((a, b) => a - b);
    const mid = Math.floor(sorted.length / 2);
    return sorted.length % 2 !== 0 
      ? sorted[mid] 
      : (sorted[mid - 1] + sorted[mid]) / 2;
  }
}

B. Conversion Strategy Pattern

javascript
Copy
Download
// conversion-strategies.js
const strategies = {
  // For merchant settlements
  merchant: (amount, rate) => {
    const converted = amount * rate;
    return Math.floor(converted * 100) / 100; // Round down to cents
  },

  // For customer charges
  customer: (amount, rate) => {
    const converted = amount * rate;
    return Math.ceil(converted * 100) / 100; // Round up to cents
  },

  // For internal accounting
  exact: (amount, rate) => amount * rate
};

function convert(amount, fromCurrency, toCurrency, strategy = 'merchant') {
  const rate = await currencyConverter.getRate(fromCurrency, toCurrency);
  return strategies[strategy](amount, rate);
}

2. Advanced Fraud Detection System

A. Multi-Layer Fraud Rules

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/fraud-detector.js
class FraudDetector {
  constructor() {
    this.rules = [
      {
        name: 'amount_velocity',
        check: async (tx) => {
          const recent = await database.query(
            `SELECT SUM(amount) as total 
             FROM transactions 
             WHERE sender = $1 AND timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '1 hour'`,
            [tx.from]
          );
          return recent.rows[0].total + tx.amount > 1000000; // 1M threshold
        }
      },
      {
        name: 'new_device',
        check: async (tx) => {
          const deviceHistory = await database.query(
            `SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT device_id) as devices 
             FROM sessions 
             WHERE user_id = $1 AND timestamp > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'`,
            [tx.userId]
          );
          return deviceHistory.rows[0].devices > 3;
        }
      }
    ];
  }

  async analyzeTransaction(tx) {
    const results = await Promise.all(
      this.rules.map(async rule => ({
        rule: rule.name,
        triggered: await rule.check(tx)
      }))
    );

    const triggeredRules = results.filter(r => r.triggered);
    const riskScore = triggeredRules.length * 25; // 25 points per rule

    return {
      riskScore: Math.min(riskScore, 100), // Cap at 100%
      triggeredRules,
      recommendedAction: riskScore > 75 ? 'block' : 
                        riskScore > 50 ? 'review' : 'allow'
    };
  }
}

B. Real-Time Risk Assessment Integration

Copy

// Enhanced payment processor
async function processPayment(tx) {
  // Step 1: Fraud check
  const fraudAnalysis = await fraudDetector.analyzeTransaction(tx);
  
  if (fraudAnalysis.recommendedAction === 'block') {
    throw new Error('Payment blocked by fraud rules');
  }

  // Step 2: Proceed with payment
  const result = await paymentService.charge(tx);

  // Step 3: Log fraud analysis
  await fraudLog.create({
    transactionId: result.id,
    riskScore: fraudAnalysis.riskScore,
    rulesTriggered: fraudAnalysis.triggeredRules
  });

  return {
    ...result,
    fraudAnalysis
  };
}

3. Merchant Settlement Optimizations

A. Intelligent Batching Algorithm

javascript
Copy
Download
// services/settlement-optimizer.js
class SettlementOptimizer {
  constructor() {
    this.batches = new Map();
  }

  async addTransaction(tx) {
    const batchKey = this._getBatchKey(tx);
    
    if (!this.batches.has(batchKey)) {
      this.batches.set(batchKey, {
        transactions: [],
        totalAmount: 0,
        currency: tx.currency
      });
    }

    const batch = this.batches.get(batchKey);
    batch.transactions.push(tx);
    batch.totalAmount += tx.amount;

    // Auto-settle if threshold reached
    if (batch.totalAmount >= this._getSettlementThreshold(tx.currency)) {
      await this._settleBatch(batchKey);
    }
  }

  _getBatchKey(tx) {
    // Group by currency + destination + weekday
    return `${tx.currency}_${tx.to}_${new Date().getDay()}`;
  }

  _getSettlementThreshold(currency) {
    const thresholds = {
      'KES': 100000,  // 100K KES
      'USD': 1000,    // 1K USD
      'EUR': 1000     // 1K EUR
    };
    return thresholds[currency] || 50000; // Default 50K
  }

  async _settleBatch(batchKey) {
    const batch = this.batches.get(batchKey);
    
    const settlement = await settlementService.createBatch({
      transactions: batch.transactions,
      totalAmount: batch.totalAmount,
      currency: batch.currency
    });

    this.batches.delete(batchKey);
    return settlement;
  }
}

B. Settlement Cost Calculator

javascript
Copy
Download
function calculateSettlementCost(batch) {
  // Base fee structure
  const fees = {
    intraBank: 0.001,    // 0.1%
    interBank: 0.0025,   // 0.25%
    crossBorder: 0.01    // 1%
  };

  // Determine settlement type
  let feeType;
  if (batch.transactions.every(t => t.toBank === batch.transactions[0].toBank)) {
    feeType = 'intraBank';
  } else if (batch.transactions.every(t => t.country === batch.transactions[0].country)) {
    feeType = 'interBank';
  } else {
    feeType = 'crossBorder';
  }

  // Calculate cost
  const feeRate = fees[feeType];
  const cost = batch.totalAmount * feeRate;

  // Apply minimum fee
  const minimums = { KES: 100, USD: 1, EUR: 1 };
  const minFee = minimums[batch.currency] || 50;

  return {
    type: feeType,
    amount: Math.max(cost, minFee),
    currency: batch.currency,
    savings: this._calculateSavings(batch, feeType)
  };
}

2. Profit Pool Implementation

A. Pool Manager Class

javascript
Copy
Download
class ProfitPool {
  constructor() {
    this.poolBalance = 0;
    this.participants = new Map(); // participantId -> {balance, sharePercentage}
    this.transactionLog = [];
  }

  async distributeProfits(amount, source = 'transaction_fees') {
    // 1. Add to pool
    this.poolBalance += amount;
    this._logTransaction('deposit', amount, source);

    // 2. Calculate and distribute to participants
    const distribution = this._calculateDistribution(amount);
    
    for (const [participantId, share] of distribution) {
      this.participants.get(participantId).balance += share;
      this._logTransaction('distribution', share, participantId);
    }

    // 3. Return distribution report
    return {
      poolBalance: this.poolBalance,
      distribution
    };
  }

  _calculateDistribution(amount) {
    const totalShares = [...this.participants.values()]
      .reduce((sum, p) => sum + p.sharePercentage, 0);
    
    return new Map(
      [...this.participants.entries()].map(([id, p]) => [
        id,
        (p.sharePercentage / totalShares) * amount
      ])
    );
  }

  _logTransaction(type, amount, metadata) {
    this.transactionLog.push({
      timestamp: new Date(),
      type,
      amount,
      metadata,
      balance: this.poolBalance
    });
  }
}
