3. Automatic Balance Tracking

A. Balance Reconciler

javascript
Copy
Download
class BalanceTracker {
  constructor() {
    this.expectedBalance = 0;
    this.actualBalance = 0;
    this.discrepancies = [];
  }

  async reconcile(expectedChange, transactionId) {
    // 1. Get real balance from ledger
    const ledgerBalance = await this._getLedgerBalance();
    
    // 2. Calculate expected
    this.expectedBalance += expectedChange;
    
    // 3. Detect discrepancies
    if (Math.abs(this.expectedBalance - ledgerBalance) > 1) { // 1 currency unit tolerance
      const discrepancy = {
        transactionId,
        expected: this.expectedBalance,
        actual: ledgerBalance,
        difference: ledgerBalance - this.expectedBalance,
        timestamp: new Date()
      };
      
      this.discrepancies.push(discrepancy);
      this.actualBalance = ledgerBalance;
      
      // Auto-correct if small difference
      if (Math.abs(discrepancy.difference) < 100) {
        this.expectedBalance = ledgerBalance;
        return { autoCorrected: true, ...discrepancy };
      }
      
      return { needsManualReview: true, ...discrepancy };
    }
    
    this.actualBalance = ledgerBalance;
    return { balanced: true };
  }

  async _getLedgerBalance() {
    // Implement actual ledger query
    return externalAccountingSystem.getBalance();
  }
}

B. Transaction Processing with Auto-Tracking

javascript
Copy
Download
async function processTransaction(tx) {
  // 1. Process payment
  const result = await paymentService.charge(tx);
  
  // 2. Track balance changes
  const reconciliation = await balanceTracker.reconcile(
    -tx.amount, // Expected reduction
    result.transactionId
  );

  // 3. Handle discrepancies
  if (reconciliation.needsManualReview) {
    await alertAccountingTeam(reconciliation);
  }

  return {
    ...result,
    reconciliation
  };
}

4. Participant Lending Facility

A. Liquidity Engine

javascript
Copy
Download
class LendingEngine {
  constructor(profitPool) {
    this.profitPool = profitPool;
    this.activeLoans = new Map();
  }

  async requestLoan(participantId, amount) {
    // 1. Check eligibility
    const participant = this.profitPool.participants.get(participantId);
    if (!participant?.terms.lendingEligibility) {
      throw new Error('Participant not eligible for loans');
    }

    // 2. Check available pool balance
    const maxLoan = participant.terms.lendingTerms.maxAmount;
    if (amount > maxLoan) {
      throw new Error(`Maximum loan amount is ${maxLoan}`);
    }

    if (amount > this.profitPool.poolBalance * 0.3) { // Max 30% of pool
      throw new Error('Insufficient pool liquidity');
    }

    // 3. Create loan
    const loan = {
      id: `loan_${Date.now()}`,
      participantId,
      amount,
      interestRate: participant.terms.lendingTerms.interestRate,
      dueDate: new Date(Date.now() + 30 * 86400000), // 30 days
      status: 'active'
    };

    // 4. Deduct from pool and disburse
    this.profitPool.poolBalance -= amount;
    this.activeLoans.set(loan.id, loan);
    
    await disburseFunds(participantId, amount);

    return loan;
  }

  async repayLoan(loanId, amount) {
    const loan = this.activeLoans.get(loanId);
    if (!loan) throw new Error('Loan not found');

    // Calculate expected repayment (amount + interest)
    const daysOutstanding = (new Date() - loan.dueDate) / 86400000;
    const interest = loan.amount * (loan.interestRate / 100) * 
      Math.max(daysOutstanding / 365, 30/365); // Minimum 30 days interest

    const totalDue = loan.amount + interest;

    if (amount < totalDue * 0.9) { // 90% of due amount minimum
      throw new Error(`Minimum repayment required: ${totalDue * 0.9}`);
    }

    // Return funds to pool
    this.profitPool.poolBalance += amount;
    loan.status = 'repaid';
    
    return {
      loanId,
      principal: loan.amount,
      interest,
      newPoolBalance: this.profitPool.poolBalance
    };
  }
}

B. Service Registry

javascript
Copy
Download
// Intel Layer Service Registry
class ServiceRegistry {
  constructor() {
    this.services = new Map();
    this.healthChecks = new Map();
  }

  register(name, endpoint, healthCheck) {
    this.services.set(name, {
      endpoint,
      lastHealthy: Date.now(),
      retryCount: 0
    });
    this.healthChecks.set(name, healthCheck);
  }

  async getService(name) {
    const service = this.services.get(name);
    if (!service) throw new Error(`Service ${name} not registered`);
    
    // Verify health status
    if (!await this._checkHealth(name)) {
      throw new Error(`Service ${name} unavailable`);
    }
    
    return service;
  }

  async _checkHealth(name) {
    try {
      const healthCheck = this.healthChecks.get(name);
      const isHealthy = await healthCheck();
      this.services.get(name).lastHealthy = Date.now();
      return isHealthy;
    } catch (error) {
      this.services.get(name).retryCount++;
      return false;
    }
  }
}

5. Service Communication

A. Event-Driven Architecture

javascript
Copy
Download
// Using Redis Streams
class EventBus {
  constructor(redis) {
    this.redis = redis;
    this.consumerGroups = new Map();
  }

  async publish(stream, event) {
    await this.redis.xadd(stream, '*', 'event', JSON.stringify(event));
  }

  async subscribe(stream, group, consumer, handler) {
    // Create consumer group if not exists
    if (!this.consumerGroups.has(group)) {
      try {
        await this.redis.xgroup('CREATE', stream, group, '0', 'MKSTREAM');
      } catch (e) {
        if (!e.message.includes('BUSYGROUP')) throw e;
      }
      this.consumerGroups.set(group, true);
    }

    // Process events
    while (true) {
      const events = await this.redis.xreadgroup(
        'GROUP', group, consumer,
        'BLOCK', 2000,
        'COUNT', 10,
        'STREAMS', stream, '>'
      );

      if (events) {
        for (const [_, streamEvents] of events) {
          for (const [id, fields] of streamEvents) {
            await handler(JSON.parse(fields.event));
            await this.redis.xack(stream, group, id);
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

B. Circuit Breaker Pattern

javascript
Copy
Download
class CircuitBreaker {
  constructor(service, options = {}) {
    this.service = service;
    this.state = 'CLOSED';
    this.failureCount = 0;
    this.resetTimeout = options.resetTimeout || 30000;
    this.failureThreshold = options.failureThreshold || 3;
  }

  async call(request) {
    if (this.state === 'OPEN') {
      if (Date.now() - this.lastFailure > this.resetTimeout) {
        this.state = 'HALF_OPEN';
      } else {
        throw new Error('Service unavailable (circuit breaker)');
      }
    }

    try {
      const response = await this.service(request);
      this._reset();
      return response;
    } catch (error) {
      this._recordFailure();
      throw error;
    }
  }

  _recordFailure() {
    this.failureCount++;
    this.lastFailure = Date.now();
    if (this.failureCount >= this.failureThreshold) {
      this.state = 'OPEN';
    }
  }

  _reset() {
    this.state = 'CLOSED';
    this.failureCount = 0;
  }
}

2. Distributed Tracing Implementation

A. OpenTelemetry Configuration

javascript
Copy
Download
// tracing.js
const { NodeTracerProvider } = require('@opentelemetry/sdk-trace-node');
const { Resource } = require('@opentelemetry/resources');
const { SemanticResourceAttributes } = require('@opentelemetry/semantic-conventions');
const { JaegerExporter } = require('@opentelemetry/exporter-jaeger');
const { BatchSpanProcessor } = require('@opentelemetry/sdk-trace-base');

const provider = new NodeTracerProvider({
  resource: new Resource({
    [SemanticResourceAttributes.SERVICE_NAME]: 'payment-router'
  })
});

const exporter = new JaegerExporter({
  endpoint: 'http://jaeger-collector:14268/api/traces'
});

provider.addSpanProcessor(new BatchSpanProcessor(exporter));
provider.register();

// Express middleware
app.use((req, res, next) => {
  const span = tracer.startSpan('HTTP_REQUEST');
  span.setAttribute('http.method', req.method);
  span.setAttribute('http.route', req.path);
  
  res.on('finish', () => {
    span.setAttribute('http.status_code', res.statusCode);
    span.end();
  });
  
  next();
});

C. Traffic Shift Script

bash
Copy
Download
#!/bin/bash
# Gradually shift traffic from blue to green
for percent in 1 5 25 50 75 100; do
  kubectl patch service payment-router \
    -p '{"spec":{"selector":{"version":"v1.3.0"}}}'
  
  echo "Shifted $percent% traffic to green"
  
  # Run smoke tests
  if ! ./run-smoke-tests.sh; then
    echo "Tests failed! Rolling back..."
    kubectl patch service payment-router \
      -p '{"spec":{"selector":{"version":"v1.2.0"}}}'
    exit 1
  fi
  
  sleep 300 # Wait 5 minutes between shifts
done

B. Failover Automation

bash
Copy
Download
#!/bin/bash
# failover.sh

# 1. Detect primary cluster failure
if ! kubectl --context=primary-cluster get ns yetupay; then
  echo "Primary cluster down! Initiating failover..."
  
  # 2. Scale up DR cluster
  kubectl --context=dr-cluster scale deploy payment-router --replicas=5
  kubectl --context=dr-cluster scale deploy intel-layer --replicas=3
  
  # 3. Update DNS
  aws route53 change-resource-record-sets \
    --hosted-zone-id Z1PA6795UKMFR9 \
    --change-batch file://dns-update.json
  
  # 4. Notify teams
  curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
    --data '{"text":"DR failover initiated"}' \
    ${SLACK_WEBHOOK}
fi

B. Code Integration for Key Operations

javascript
Copy
Download
// crypto-service.js
const { CloudHSM } = require('aws-cloudhsm-js');

class HSMService {
  constructor() {
    this.client = new CloudHSM({
      partition: process.env.HSM_PARTITION,
      cryptoUser: process.env.HSM_USER,
      password: process.env.HSM_PASSWORD
    });
  }

  async encryptData(data) {
    const keyHandle = await this.client.getKeyHandle('payment-encryption-key');
    return this.client.encrypt(keyHandle, data, 'AES_256_CBC');
  }

  async signTransaction(txData) {
    const keyHandle = await this.client.getKeyHandle('transaction-signing-key');
    const digest = crypto.createHash('sha512').update(txData).digest();
    return this.client.sign(keyHandle, digest, 'ECDSA_SHA512');
  }
}

2. Quantum-Resistant Cryptography

A. CRYSTALS-Kyber Key Exchange

javascript
Copy
Download
// quantum-safe-crypto.js
const { kyber } = require('pqc-kyber');

class QuantumSafeCrypto {
  generateKeyPair() {
    return kyber.keypair();
  }

  encrypt(publicKey, message) {
    return kyber.encrypt(publicKey, Buffer.from(message));
  }

  decrypt(privateKey, ciphertext) {
    return kyber.decrypt(privateKey, ciphertext).toString();
  }
}

// Hybrid encryption example
async function hybridEncrypt(data, hsm, quantumCrypto) {
  // Step 1: Generate quantum-safe session key
  const { publicKey, privateKey } = quantumCrypto.generateKeyPair();
  
  // Step 2: Encrypt data with HSM-backed AES
  const encryptedData = await hsm.encryptData(data);
  
  // Step 3: Encrypt AES key with quantum-safe crypto
  const encryptedKey = quantumCrypto.encrypt(publicKey, encryptedData.key);
  
  return {
    ciphertext: encryptedData.ciphertext,
    encryptedKey,
    quantumPublicKey: publicKey.toString('base64'),
    hsmMetadata: encryptedData.metadata
  };
}

B. Key Rotation Automation

python
Copy
Download
# key-rotator.py
def rotate_keys():
    # 1. Generate new key in each cloud
    aws_key = AWSKMS.generate_data_key(key_id="payment-key", key_spec="AES_256")
    gcp_key = GCPKMS.generate_data_key(key_id="projects/yetupay/locations/global/keyRings/payment/cryptoKeys/payment-key")
    
    # 2. Re-encrypt data
    for record in PaymentData.objects.all():
        old_key = get_key_from_hsm(record.key_version)
        decrypted = decrypt_with_hsm(old_key, record.ciphertext)
        
        # Dual-write with new keys
        record.ciphertext_aws = encrypt_with_kms(aws_key, decrypted)
        record.ciphertext_gcp = encrypt_with_kms(gcp_key, decrypted)
        record.key_version = "v2"
        record.save()
    
    # 3. Update key aliases
    AWSKMS.update_alias(alias_name="alias/payment-current", target_key_id=aws_key)
    GCPKMS.update_alias(f"projects/yetupay/locations/global/keyRings/payment/cryptoKeys/payment-current", gcp_key)

    # 4. Schedule old key deletion (after 7 days)
    schedule_key_deletion(old_aws_key, delay=604800)
    schedule_key_deletion(old_gcp_key, delay=604800)

1. HSM Performance Optimization

A. Connection Pooling Configuration

javascript
Copy
Download
// hsm-connection-manager.js
class HSMConnectionPool {
  constructor(options = {}) {
    this.poolSize = options.poolSize || 10;
    this.connections = [];
    this.waitQueue = [];
    
    // Warm up the pool
    this._initializePool();
  }

  async _initializePool() {
    for (let i = 0; i < this.poolSize; i++) {
      this.connections.push(await this._createHSMConnection());
    }
  }

  async _createHSMConnection() {
    const hsm = new CloudHSM({
      partition: process.env.HSM_PARTITION,
      cryptoUser: process.env.HSM_USER,
      password: process.env.HSM_PASSWORD,
      tcpKeepAlive: true,  // Maintain persistent connections
      socketTimeout: 30000  // 30-second timeout
    });
    
    await hsm.connect();
    return hsm;
  }

  async execute(operation) {
    if (this.connections.length > 0) {
      const hsm = this.connections.pop();
      try {
        const result = await operation(hsm);
        this.connections.push(hsm);
        return result;
      } catch (error) {
        // Recreate failed connection
        this.connections.push(await this._createHSMConnection());
        throw error;
      }
    } else {
      // Enqueue operation when pool exhausted
      return new Promise((resolve) => {
        this.waitQueue.push(() => {
          resolve(this.execute(operation));
        });
      });
    }
  }
}

// Usage
const hsmPool = new HSMConnectionPool({ poolSize: 15 });

async function signWithPooledHSM(data) {
  return hsmPool.execute(async (hsm) => {
    return hsm.sign('transaction-key', data);
  });
}

2. Quantum Algorithm Benchmarks

A. Performance Comparison

python

# quantum_benchmark.py
import time
from pqcrypto.sign.dilithium import dilithium2, dilithium3
from pqcrypto.kem.kyber import kyber512, kyber768

def benchmark(func, iterations=1000):
    start = time.time()
    for _ in range(iterations):
        func()
    return (time.time() - start) / iterations

# Key generation benchmarks
print(f"Dilithium2 keygen: {benchmark(dilithium2.generate_keypair):.6f}s")
print(f"Kyber-512 keygen: {benchmark(kyber512.generate_keypair):.6f}s")

# Signing/encryption benchmarks
pk, sk = dilithium2.generate_keypair()
msg = b"test_message"
print(f"Dilithium2 sign: {benchmark(lambda: dilithium2.sign(sk, msg)):.6f}s")

pk, sk = kyber512.generate_keypair()
print(f"Kyber-512 encaps: {benchmark(lambda: kyber512.encapsulate(pk)):.6f}s")

# fedramp_checks.py
import boto3, google.cloud.monitoring

class FedRAMPValidator:
    def check_encryption_at_rest(self):
        # AWS check
        aws_ebs = boto3.client('ec2').get_ebs_encryption_by_default()
        aws_rds = boto3.client('rds').describe_db_instances()
        
        # GCP check
        gcp_disks = google.cloud.compute_v1.Disk.list(project='yetupay')
        
        return {
            'aws_ebs_encrypted': aws_ebs['EbsEncryptionByDefault'],
            'aws_rds_encrypted': all(db['StorageEncrypted'] for db in aws_rds['DBInstances']),
            'gcp_disks_encrypted': all(disk.disk_encryption_key for disk in gcp_disks)
        }

    def check_access_logging(self):
        # Check CloudTrail and Stackdriver
        aws_trail = boto3.client('cloudtrail').describe_trails()
        gcp_logs = google.cloud.logging_v2.Client().list_entries(filter_='logName:"projects/yetupay/logs/cloudaudit.googleapis.com"')
        
        return {
            'aws_cloudtrail_enabled': any(trail['IsMultiRegionTrail'] for trail in aws_trail['trailList']),
            'gcp_audit_logs_enabled': len(list(gcp_logs)) > 0
        }

4. Cross-Cloud Key Synchronization

A. Multi-Cloud Key Mirroring

go
Copy
Download
// key-sync/main.go
package main

import (
	"context"
	"time"
	
	"github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/kms"
	"golang.org/x/oauth2/google"
	"google.golang.org/api/cloudkms/v1"
)

func syncKeys(ctx context.Context) error {
	// 1. Get current AWS keys
	awsClient := kms.NewFromConfig(awsConfig)
	awsKeys, err := awsClient.ListKeys(ctx, &kms.ListKeysInput{})
	if err != nil {
		return err
	}

	// 2. Get current GCP keys
	gcpClient, err := cloudkms.NewService(ctx, 
		option.WithCredentialsFile("gcp-creds.json"))
	gcpKeys, err := gcpClient.Projects.Locations.KeyRings.CryptoKeys.List(
		"projects/yetupay/locations/global").Do()

	// 3. Mirror missing keys
	for _, awsKey := range awsKeys.Keys {
		if !existsInGCP(awsKey.KeyId, gcpKeys) {
			createGCPKey(gcpClient, awsKey.KeyId)
		}
	}

	// 4. Schedule next sync
	time.AfterFunc(6*time.Hour, func() { syncKeys(ctx) })
	return nil
}

B. Conflict Resolution Strategy

javascript
Copy
Download
// key-conflict-resolver.js
class KeyConflictResolver {
  constructor() {
    this.strategies = {
      'HIGH_RISK': this.highRiskStrategy,
      'LOW_RISK': this.lowRiskStrategy,
      'DATA_LOSS': this.dataLossStrategy
    };
  }

  async resolve(conflict) {
    const strategy = this._determineStrategy(conflict);
    return this.strategies[strategy](conflict);
  }

  _determineStrategy(conflict) {
    if (conflict.potentialDataLoss) return 'DATA_LOSS';
    if (conflict.riskScore > 75) return 'HIGH_RISK';
    return 'LOW_RISK';
  }

  highRiskStrategy(conflict) {
    // Freeze operations and alert
    return {
      action: 'FREEZE',
      message: 'High-risk conflict detected',
      requiresManualReview: true
    };
  }

  lowRiskStrategy(conflict) {
    // Automatically use most recent
    const latest = [conflict.cloudA, conflict.cloudB]
      .sort((a, b) => b.lastUpdated - a.lastUpdated)[0];
    
    return {
      action: 'USE_LATEST',
      chosenVersion: latest.version,
      timestamp: latest.lastUpdated
    };
  }
}

A. Zero-Downtime Update Process

Diagram

Implementation Script:

bash
Copy

#!/bin/bash
# hsm-firmware-update.sh

# 1. Pre-flight checks
if ! hsm-health-check; then
  echo "HSM health check failed. Aborting update."
  exit 1
fi

# 2. Backup configuration
hsm-backup --output /secure/backups/hsm-config-$(date +%Y%m%d).tar.gpg

# 3. Stage firmware on all nodes
parallel-scp -h hsm-nodes.txt -l hsmadmin \
  -p 32 /tmp/hsm-firmware-3.2.1.bin /opt/cloudhsm/firmware/

# 4. Update standby nodes first
for node in $(grep standby hsm-nodes.txt); do
  ssh hsmadmin@$node "sudo cloudhsm-cli firmware-update \
    --firmware /opt/cloudhsm/firmware/hsm-firmware-3.2.1.bin \
    --no-reboot"
done

# 5. Failover and update primary nodes
hsm-cluster failover --primary-to=hsmsb01
sleep 300 # Wait for stabilization

for node in $(grep primary hsm-nodes.txt); do
  ssh hsmadmin@$node "sudo cloudhsm-cli firmware-update \
    --firmware /opt/cloudhsm/firmware/hsm-firmware-3.2.1.bin \
    --reboot"
done

# 6. Validate
if ! hsm-validate-all; then
  echo "Validation failed! Initiating rollback..."
  hsm-rollback --from-backup /secure/backups/hsm-config-*.tar.gpg
  exit 1
fi

echo "HSM firmware update completed successfully"

B. Cryptographic Erasure Verification

python
Copy
Download
# hsm-sanitize-check.py
import hashlib

def verify_erasure(partition):
    # 1. Get zeroized HSM memory dump
    mem_dump = get_hsm_memory_dump(partition)
    
    # 2. Verify all cryptographic material is erased
    if any(b != 0 for b in mem_dump[:CRYPTO_REGION_SIZE]):
        raise SecurityException("Cryptographic material not fully erased")
    
    # 3. Verify firmware checksum
    expected_hash = "a1b2c3d4e5f67890..."
    actual_hash = hashlib.sha3_256(mem_dump[FIRMWARE_REGION]).hexdigest()
    
    if actual_hash != expected_hash:
        raise FirmwareIntegrityError("Firmware verification failed")

    return True

B. Automated Validation Suite

python
Copy
Download
# fips-validator.py
from cryptography.hazmat.backends import default_backend
from pqcrypto import fips202, kyber768

class FIPSValidator:
    def run_kyber_tests(self):
        # SP 800-56Cr2 Key Establishment
        pk, sk = kyber768.generate_keypair()
        ct, ss = kyber768.encapsulate(pk)
        ss2 = kyber768.decapsulate(sk, ct)
        
        assert ss == ss2, "Key establishment failed"
        
        # Known Answer Tests (KAT)
        test_vectors = load_nist_kat_vectors()
        for vec in test_vectors:
            result = kyber768.encapsulate(vec['pk'])
            assert result == vec['expected'], f"KAT failed for vector {vec['id']}"

    def run_entropy_tests(self):
        # Continuous RNG test (FIPS 140-3 Section 4.9.2)
        last_value = None
        for _ in range(1000):
            new_value = fips202.shake256(32)
            if new_value == last_value:
                raise EntropyFailure("RNG duplicate output detected")
            last_value = new_value

    description = "TLS from Internet"

    to_port     = 500
    protocol    = "udp"

    description = "IPSec from DMZ"

  # Egress rules

    from_port   = 0
    to_port     = 0
    protocol    = "-1"
    cidr_blocks = ["10.0.100.0/24"]
    description = "Only to Data Tier"
  }
}

B. Legal Hold Implementation

go
Copy
Download
// legal-hold.go
package main

import (
	"context"
	"time"
	
	"cloud.google.com/go/storage"
	"github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/s3"
)

type LegalHoldManager struct {
	S3Client    *s3.Client
	GCSClient   *storage.Client
	Retention   time.Duration
}

func (l *LegalHoldManager) ApplyHold(bucket, object string) error {
	// AWS S3 Implementation
	_, err := l.S3Client.PutObjectLegalHold(context.TODO(), &s3.PutObjectLegalHoldInput{
		Bucket: &bucket,
		Key:    &object,
		LegalHold: &types.ObjectLockLegalHold{
			Status: types.ObjectLockLegalHoldStatusOn,
		},
	})

	// GCS Implementation
	_, err = l.GCSClient.Bucket(bucket).Object(object).Update(context.TODO(), storage.ObjectAttrsToUpdate{
		EventBasedHold: true,
	})

	return err
}

func (l *LegalHoldManager) ReleaseAfter(bucket, object string, releaseTime time.Time) {
	// Schedule release
	time.AfterFunc(time.Until(releaseTime), func() {
		l.S3Client.PutObjectLegalHold(..., Status: types.ObjectLockLegalHoldStatusOff)
		l.GCSClient.Bucket(bucket).Object(object).Update(..., EventBasedHold: false)
	})
}

B. Evidence Collection Script

python
Copy

# fedramp-evidence-collector.py
import boto3, datetime

def collect_evidence():
    # 1. IAM Evidence
    iam = boto3.client('iam')
    mfa_users = [u for u in iam.list_users()['Users'] 
                if iam.list_mfa_devices(UserName=u['UserName'])['MFADevices']]
    
    # 2. Logging Evidence
    cloudtrail = boto3.client('cloudtrail')
    trails = cloudtrail.describe_trails()['trailList']
    
    # 3. Vulnerability Evidence
    inspector = boto3.client('inspector')
    findings = inspector.list_findings(
        filter={'severity': ['High', 'Critical']}
    )['findingArns']
    
    return {
        'collection_date': datetime.datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
        'mfa_coverage': f"{len(mfa_users)}/{len(users)}",
        'cloudtrail_integrity': all(t['LogFileValidationEnabled'] for t in trails),
        'open_critical_vulns': len(findings)
    }

A. Cross-Border Transfer Emergency Stop

# emergency-stop-transfer.py
import boto3, google.cloud.storage

def stop_all_transfers():
    # AWS Side
    s3 = boto3.client('s3')
    for bucket in s3.list_buckets()['Buckets']:
        if 'cross-border' in bucket['Name']:
            s3.put_bucket_policy(
                Bucket=bucket['Name'],
                Policy='{"Version":"2012-10-17","Statement":[{"Effect":"Deny","Principal":"*","Action":"s3:*","Resource":"*"}]}'
            )
    
    # GCP Side
    storage_client = google.cloud.storage.Client()
    for bucket in storage_client.list_buckets():
        if bucket.name.startswith('yetupay-import-'):
            bucket.iam_configuration.uniform_bucket_level_access_enabled = True
            bucket.patch()

B. FIPS Mode Verification

go
Copy
Download
// fips-check.go
package main

import (
	"crypto/tls"
	"log"
)

func main() {
	// 1. Verify TLS configuration
	conn, err := tls.Dial("tcp", "payment.yetupay.io:443", &tls.Config{
		InsecureSkipVerify: true,
	})
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}
	defer conn.Close()

	// 2. Check cipher suite
	if conn.ConnectionState().CipherSuite != tls.TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 {
		log.Fatal("Non-FIPS cipher suite detected")
	}

	// 3. Verify HSM mode
	resp, err := http.Get("https://hsm.yetupay.io/fips-mode")
	if err != nil || resp.StatusCode != 200 {
		log.Fatal("HSM not in FIPS mode")
	}
}
